result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark William Ellestad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark William Ellestad is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark William Ellestad was found guilty of Possession of Improvised Explosives [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.31(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED.
-Court dismisses Counts 2 - 5.
-Court notes 348 days credit if revoked.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.
-Defendant to participate in MRT.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Julie A. Weber, DF:  Mark William Ellestad appeared from jail.  Court called.  Attorneys make sentencing arguments.  DE makes statement.  DE makes statement.  Crt orders:

IMPOSED/STAYED
- DE sentenced to 3 years I/C and 3 years E/S
- 3 years probation 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Testing upon reasonable suspicion of the probation agent or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.
- DE to participate in MRT
- 348 days credit for time served if revoked
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250 for the DNA surchage to be paid through the DOC
- DE to sign up for probation before being released from St. Croix County Jail
- 20 days to appeal
for Copies. From Pierce County DA's Office. Mailed on 2/24/2016. km

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser,  DF ATTY: Julie A. Weber, DF: Mark William Ellestad appeared.  Court called at 9:05 a.m.  There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1.  No contest plea is entered.  Court reviews the police reports from the incident.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2, Ct 3, Ct 4 & Ct 5.   Court orders a PSI long form and is recommending a COMPAS Evaluation.  Court will set a SEH once the PSI is reviewed.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 9:16 a.m. lw
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-03-2015 09:00 am

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Julie A. Weber, DF: Mark William Ellestad appeared.  Court called at 3:26 p.m.  Attorney Weber advises the court they are close to a resolution.  Set out for Plea/Sentencing.   On the record the Court denies the Motion for Reconsideration that was filed by Attorney Weber with the Court.  Attorney Weber argues bond. Bond is continued.  Court adjourned at 3:30 p.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley , DF ATTY: Julie A. Weber, DF:  Mark William Ellestad appeared from jail.  Court called at 11:10 a.m.  Set for a Preliminary Hearing.   DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Court reviews the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver with the DE.  Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Bail is continued.  Set out for arraignment.  Court adjourned at 11:13 a.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 10:45 am.
